reviews.review_msg: A lot of the material in the exams were things he never he mentioned in class. Expecting us to learn large portions of chapters and online articles on our own, when he could easily have covered them in class is frustrating. The grading criteria is unclear and has a poor attitude towards students.
he is ok. too much little stuff that makes you have to go to class?
Solid prof. Very helpful and kind.
goated prof. lectures are interesting. my stage 4 insta brainrot is cured

The grading, the ta, the rng in this course is definitely bad. Its disappointing that the Prof is still decent but the TA is a meh grader! At this point even a final exam would've been a fairer reflection of the learning than the badly graded final projects. If u see the TA is Fetih please drop!!!!

The professor is decent but the TA for this course Fateh does not grade team prjects fairly so beware of that. Overall the rubric and the comments of feedback do not even align since no samples or actual guidleines are provided so it is all luck based and random. The TA for this course was not helpful at all!
Prof was always talking about his dad's business and how successful he is. TA was terrible at marking and contradicted his marking.

He's a chill prof and his lectures are pretty interesting. Only annoying thing is his slides are basically copy and pasted from the textbook and in the syllabus it says you need to buy the textbook, I wouldn't recommend it. Don't love the amount of group work for this class, especially since peer ratings can't boost your own marks, but no final.

He is a very good professor. I really like that he bridges his experience as a real business person to the class room while also sharing case studies that he has direct involvement in. I really hope he continues to teach these courses at SFU. Highly recommended.

Amazing and engaging lectures. Outline is clear for assignments, tests, and quizzes. Lectures are recorded which is a bonus so attendance isn't mandatory. TA does mark assignments a bit harsh but non the less, one of my favourite professors by far at SFU! Would take again. He's also super knowledgeable in business so you're in good hands.

Prof is amazing. Lectures are super interesting and I always pay attention. Provides recordings of the lectures just in case you miss a few which is extremely helpful. The TA on the other hand is a rough grader. Doesn't give good feedback to justify him grading my paper harshly.
great prof

I took this course with him in fall 2023, and in my opinion there is really nothing more I could ask from a professor. Explains things extremely clearly and concisely, makes it interesting and personal with loads of examples and anecdotes that really help you understand the concepts. Exams were fair if you paid attention and studied. Thank you!

Terrific professor that gave clear feedback on top of incorporating informative real life examples into his lectures. Just wished that the curving & scaling wasn't so harsh as it adversely affected my final letter grade by the end of the course.
Great prof with lots of experience.
Sasha is solid. Lots of experience and knowledge.

Sasha is the best prof I've had. His lectures are clear, concise, and to the point, ignoring anything irrelevant to the course material, while also sprinkling in interesting anecdotes about he and his father's personal experience in the restaurant business. He is always available to talk after class, and he is personable and accommodating.

Sasha is a great prof. He is very generous when it comes to grading and outlines (TAs too). He is also always available for a question or a chat after lecture, and his explanations are concise and straightforward. He is also pretty funny, and his lectures are well-structured. The group work can be a luck-of-the-draw situation though
Love his sneakers under the suit.

Each team shares the same grade in the two group assignments. The 2nd grp asmt has a peer eval. to make sure that everyone participated fairly and prof will adjust the marks of those lazy and free riders. The grading policy is decided by the prof so the reviewer here that said TAs are lazy is wrong. Read each chapter to prepare for quizzes & exams.

The course content itself is ok, can be alot to learn for sure, as well as many group projects and presentations needed to be done. Sasha is a very good professor, one of the best I've had so far, he explains content very well (explains many examples) and is such an understanding person. If you can take a class with Sasha, 100% do it.

Good Prof, horrible class. I was stuck with the worst group members and ended up doing most of the work just to receive a C on our large assignment. The TA's are lazy and won't grade anyone based on their own contribution, its all group marks. Super upsetting and frustrating class.

Sasha is one of the top professors I've had at SFU, his expectations are perfect and understands students and tries to help them when possible. His grading criteria is also very respectable and is exactly what is expected. Put an effort and you will do well (and I'm not just saying that).

Sam is super inspirational and caring. If you need advise or motivation, come to him ;-) In terms of grading, I would say he is not an easy grader, but not a tough grader either. Just make sure you explain everything thoroughly, and try to find good examples for every question (even when he only asks for the definition).
Best semester so far thanks to him.. Super inspirational and help you to look beyond your current course and discover your true calling in life!

Sam is a fantastic mentor figure. He is a storyteller, so you will stay focused as long as he speaks. He is 10/10 in everything. The course concepts are interesting. Highly recommend. He has the power to bring out the leader in you.

Sam is a really nice person, I took the ASYNC and 80% of the lecture was him talking about himself, got kinda tired of that after the 3rd class tbh. He's tough but fair with the grading, his projects are somehow interesting. Not bad, but not great.

Sam is really kind and understanding. He is honestly one of the best Profs at FIC and SFU! He is always available to take questions and also appreciate them. His assignments aren't that hard if you're comfortable reflecting and giving your input to the questions he asks.
The lectores are easy to understand and complements well with the book. The exams are very large but easy. The best from this course are the office hours. He is really friendly.

He is a really good professor. Cares a lot for his students, calm and takes time to give feedback on how to improve. Only required to read the textbook briefly and make sure to pay attention to his lectures. Quizzes were relatively easy just make sure to listen to lecture and briefly read textbook. Exams were great! 24 hours. No cap, best prof!

If you want to learn "Business'' and not just look to pass another course, I would highly advise you to take Sams, class. He is the nicest person, and if you just pay full attention and take notes during his lectures, you'll get higher than average grade. Look out for his inspirational ending speech, I won't spoil it don't worry. Good luck guys!!
Choosing Sam's class was the best choice of my 1st semester.
A really nice guy. I don't think he is teaching great but it isn't his fault.

Great speaker and explains topics very well. Lectures are made engaging with personal stories and videos. He treats you like and equal and boosts ur desire to study. Interacts with all students in class everyday and creates a student-instructor bond. Answers any questions in class, even the dumb ones. However, u must read the book to pass his class
Sam tries very hard but the material he teaches is VERY introductory. I didn't feel I got full value for my time.
The best professor i have ever seen in my life. He is a role model for me.
Honestly, LOVED his class. He is nice, kind, understanding and inspiring. I would love to take his class again.
Sam does reasonably well with the low level material.
There is nothing wrong with Thiara's teaching style, but "awesome"? Not my word for him. I'd have no difficulty taking him again.

Sam is a really good and respectable teacher. He is extremely inspirational, he will talk to you about life advice as well. He is a good listener to his students and a wonderful teacher. However, if you take his course, study not only from his lectures but from the textbook as well and don't forget to elaborate more on your paper. Overall, the best
good professor
Easiest course ever!
legend
He really make learning fun. Most inspirational professor. Besides he is a great motivational force.

I like Sam and he does try hard. Perhaps it is the content but much if the course seemed like common sense and not new for us. Maybe there was nothing Sam could do about it but I was frequently bored.
AMAZING INSTRUCTOR. IF YOU EVER PLAN TO TAKE BUS200 TAKE IT WITH HIM. YOU WOUNT EVER REGRET YOUR CHOICE.
He was a very nice, good, caring professor I had seen in FIC. If u get a low grade, who will encourage you and gave u some suggestion and help u.

Sam is really nice and smart. Although I am not his BUS200 student this semester, each of my friend told me that he is caring and glad to answer your questions. Luckily I attended his review class and I found his classcture really interesting. In my eyes Sam and Alia are both the best BUS200 instructors. Look forward to learning BUS272 with you.
Best professor of bus200. He teaches so well and always there to help you. Ready to take him again. you will get a lot of inspiration from him.

He was a good prof but tended to go off on tangents during his lectures. The tangents focused more on the students and our growth than the actual course material. Tests are heavily influenced by the textbook not the lectures at all. But attending the lectures gives you some fun stories and thought-provoking ideas. He really cares about his students

I never feel sad after week 13 ended. However, when bus 200 ended I feel really empty, added with how Sam says goodbye with a presentation at the end. I really love the way he teaches and this is the best prof I have ever got in my life. He's so kind, motivated and inspiring.
Sam did a reasonable job but I can't say he was excellent. He does try hard but he seems to be a salesman sometimes.
Respected prof
Sam is really chilled and makes the course easier for you. In my opinion he's the best beedie proff.

definitely my fav professor of this semester!! So caring and inspiring. I can tell that he puts his heart and soul into teaching. his lecture notes might not be super helpful for the exams but still good for your learning.
Easy going guy, approachable really
He gave everyone very high a score of assignment and presentation. He shared lots of funny stuffy during his lecture also if you read and memories the textbook, you can get A!
Great prof with a sense of humour what makes 4-hour lecture past as 1 hour, grades are fair and the course is interesting even if it's not your major.

Lectures are useless and horribly structured. Read the textbook and you are golden. An inefficient professor, and has vague expectations. For example, the group project was poorly designed and she was a nit-picky marker. The final and midterm exams were reasonable. The class was easy, but the professor made it annoyingly more difficult.

Really great Prof, she actually cares about her students, there was a quite few readings to do. You must attend her lectures to get participation marks. But her exams were fair and the TA who was grading my other work was a bit of stickler for formatting but, overall decent class. Had fun as an elective

Ms. Matheson is a caring, sweet, and sympathetic professor. I recommend her %100. Her exams are detailed multiple choices; registering for Pearson might help you practice some more multiple-choice questions. However, it is not mandatory. It is best to read the book and use her slides to organize your thoughts.

Nice and standard prof! Did flipped classes during covid so you were required to go over material on your own and then ask questions during class. Quizzes were easy if you read textbook. Lots of group assignments which I didnt like/were hard and unclear. Willing to help if you had questions! Not a bad prof but wish she explained some concepts more

The worst professor I have ever had, way beneath SFU standards. 10-12/80+ students in attendance. Lectures not remotely related to course material. Only does "discussions" smarter of which I have had with my dog. And too many polls. Lecture contains NOTHING learnable, 0 learning is done in class. Only possible by reading the textbook on your own.

Lectures are pointless. He's a nice person but everything taught in lectures is already posted and learnable from his powerpoint or the textbook. There is also in-class assignments where you must read articles and in a sense memorize material to do well on them. Also expect weekly online quizzes on textbook chapters before every class.

He is nice and talkative. However, if u really want to learn something and get good grades, DO NOT take his class. The lecture is useless and there's so much quiz. The quiz is before the class and team project really matters.
Believe me Sarb is one the toughest prof in marking test. She only taught ppt in class which made me feel so boring throughout the course. If this is not require then don't choose her.

She might seem a fair and kind but a harsh grader, but she isn't. Despite her lies to be fair, she doesn't take her students concerns seriously. Don't wait good grades if you start on the wrong foot then get sick. She is only understands her A+ students. Don't take her class if you don't need to, you don't deserve that. Take care and good luck.

Sarb is one of the toughest professor, RUN! Her voice is not clear even if you sit in front, break time is just 10 minutes, she don't accept your opinion. Prepared for quiz, in class writing, readings, 2 exams, individual assignments, teamwork, & presentations! Overall, if this is mandatory then maybe take it, but if it's elective course then NO!
Great Instructor at all, all the BUS 200 students should take her classes!
Wonderful!!
Excellent!
You will enjoy this wonderful and fun business course journey!!!
She is a wonderful professor!

She is an okay teacher (bit of karen vibes ngl) but as long as she likes you, you should be fine. Just remember that she makes you buy an 80 dollars textbook from pearsons for her class (none of my other class teachers have asked that from the students). so be prepared for that.
She is amazing!
She is a very good professor and highly recommends you to choose to study with her! Best!
only taught ppt's in class and class was always boring. Explanation was not sufficient.

Sarb is one of the finest professors I have seen. Though she is a tough grader, but if you come in her good books and participate in the class from the starting of the course, you will definitely get a solid A in her course. I would definitely take her in BUS216

You will clearly know what needed to do, deadline She will present with her PowerPoint which makes more clear. Mostly assignments, midterm and final exams are case study. Quizzes refer to the things she said in the lessons. Everything is clear. The marking is fair I think. I am not good in writing but my quizzes are quit good so B. Cry

Sarb is actually a good instructir. She is very inspiring and prepares you for the corporate world. You just need to pay attention in class and always read the text book after the lectures. Before exams, go through the review slides she posts and youll be fine. She is amazing, just be respectful to her.

Sarb is a really good teacher. You need to ask her questions so she can give you the answers. You need to be hard working and she really likes students that have motivation so be ready to show your enthusiasm at first. Read the text book and the PowerPoint. These will give you good grade.

she is a nice person, you can ask lots of question and she is fine, but she is a tough grader and she always try to show she is doing fair. But boring classes is the thing that made me afraid of her class.
An absoloute gem of a professor! Choose him as your professor and do yourself a favour! One of the best professors i've had in my life.
He is a very understanding professor, he teaches well and tries his best to make his class interactive, and will explain till everyone has understood it.
He is the best teacher I've ever had. Arriba Daryl!!!!!
Hes the best professor I have ever had
His lesson was fun
He is the best instructor in my university life. He is caring, a motivator and, a mentor. He has vast business world experiences. You can ask any question, and you will answer it.
He is definitely one of the best prof. He is caring and approachable.

DJ is an amazing teacher. He is very caring and supportive. If we got some answers wrong, he always gives good feedback on how we can fix it. His lectures are mostly about his experience so that we can understand better about what we study. However, we need to do more reading and ask him for additional information in order to get a higher grade.
DJ Fuller is extremely caring about his students. He gives good grades as well. His lecture slides and explanations are informative and helpful. He is a very easy going and laid back professor.
Liked her class. Good lectures.
I liked her lectures. She used a lot of real world examples and tried to keep us engaged. Overall, it was a good course.
She is engaging and interesting.Lectures were good. Exams were easy if you attended classes.

My overall grade was lower than I had hoped that it would be. When I raised the issue with Parveen, she was responsive and explained that she had to grade to the curve and even offered to write me a letter of recommendation to get into the program that I am applying to.

Overall, I think she was amazing. Clear, caring and knows her stuff.

I would say the reason someone should take a class with her would be, because all her exam questions come from the textbooks practice question which you can easily find the pdf for on studoc. Besides that she isn't a very understanding nor considerate teacher. She arrives to class late religiously, and then complain that presentation run long.

I think Parveen was new when I took her course. She tended to be unorganized with class presentations and her grading wasn't the clearest. But she was caring and open to help students if they needed it.
Good prof! Interesting lectures and real world examples. Group work heavy.
Lectures are long, but great professor, informative lectures, and exams are do-able if you do the readings.

One of the best professors I have ever taken. She's incredibly kind and her voice is so calming to listen to during lectures. She is incredibly reasonable with her marking and explains the guidelines very specifically. Highly recommend her for BUS 200!!
Great Prof, truly passionate about what she teaches! Thank you Peng
Her English is not good. I had my grade deducted because she assumes the word "can" implies certainty. What is worst is that her feedbacks do not extend beyond the attempt to justify her own mistake.
